text:
decay exponentially. Alpha is often set to a value between 0 and 1. Large values mean that the
model pays attention mainly to the most recent past observations, whereas smaller values mean
more of the history is taken into account when making a prediction.
A value close to 1 indicates fast learning (that is, only the most recent values
inﬂuence the forecasts), whereas a value close to 0 indicates slow learning (past
observations have a large inﬂuence on forecasts).
